website_summaries.verdict: Top choice for beginning to intermediate band users.
pros: 5 bands, each of different weights, so you can find your ideal resistance for each exercise
Purchase includes eBook and online videos
Bonus points for also assisting in ab, butt and arm workouts
Carrying bag also included to make traveling with bands easier
cons: Some reports that bands roll up  legs if you place them on bare skin

customer_reviews.title: Very short and thin, hard for me to use, just rolls up and down my limbs, maybe best for a child vs adult
customer_reviews.text: Very short and thin, they just roll up and down my limbs and I’m 5’3” so I have no idea how anyone taller could use them and I am very afraid they’re going to break and snap me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! Spend a little more and get fabric
customer_reviews.text: They roll something terrible! I have tried to double the bands, and they still roll. Then they stick to themselves and it take a while to get them back to normal. An hour workout will turn into 2 with these bands.
customer_reviews.author: Happy shopper

customer_reviews.title: So sad, just buy the beach body ones and save ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these for 80 Day obsession in 5'2 130 lbs and they are constantly rolling never had them not roll. So sad, just buy the beach body ones and save your money. It is very uncomfortable when they roll and I would rather focus on my workout instead of the rolling band.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: The bands will break at the joint
customer_reviews.text: All of the bands have broken. They all break at the spot where they join the band to make a loop. In general the bands have a good amount of resistance and the 5 included are a good mix from lowest to highest resistance. I have been using them for IT Band rehab for the past few months, starting with the lowest resistance. But after a few weeks of use they stretch at the joint and then break. I just move up to the next higher resistance and, however they are all broken now. If you do buy these don't expect them to last long.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Ok bands
customer_reviews.text: I have had these bands for several weeks, I use them daily, and thus far they have been perfect. I had never really integrated resistance band exercises into my routine but I am glad i did. These bands are great for a bunch of very effective workouts on your upper and lower body. I wasn’t sure how best to use them but luckily they come with a very straightforward pamphlet that covers a bunch of great excercises. The carrying case is also a nice plus because without it they would add clutter for sure. I definitely recommend! Edit: unfortunately after a month or so my heavy has ripped...so not quite as durable as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Like using a fruit roll up
customer_reviews.text: I get it that all fitness bands can roll up on you, but these stick together so bad when they do it ruins a workout. It can take up to 45 seconds to work them apart.
customer_reviews.author: james hugh

customer_reviews.title: It’s horrible. Save your money and buy a thicker band
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use for beach body’s 80 Day Obsession workout. I spend more time trying to get them to lay flat than I actually do working out. They not only roll but get stuck together. It’s horrible. Save your money and buy a thicker band.
customer_reviews.author: j. wood

customer_reviews.title: I gave 2 stars since they still felt pretty strong and the resistance was good when they weren't ...
customer_reviews.text: I used them for the first time today and I am already returning them. They rolled for nearly every exercise, but thats not even my main reason for the return. I am returning because I cant stand the smell!! It has been on my body all day even after showering and washing my hands several times. Its making me sick to my stomach. I am going to order from a brand that is non-latex and hope I don't have the same issue. Though I am returning, I gave 2 stars since they still felt pretty strong and the resistance was good when they weren't rolling.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Davies

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality, golds/rolls immediately.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible quality. Super flimsy and no resistance worth trying to work out with unless possibly for an elderly person, but they fold/roll immediately. I unpackaged and bypassed to x heavy black band as all others were not worth trying. As soon as I put on and did one m9ve it folded as shown in picture. Bummer... would rate 0 if I could. I don't even work out much, was hoping to at home with these.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as I wanted more variety in my fitness bands. However, these bands do not fit my needs at all. The lightest band is TOO light so I'll never use it. The black band, which is the heaviest, is not heavy enough. Also, I wear shorts 99% of the time when I'm working out. When these are on my legs or thighs, they constantly are rolling up and do not stay in place well at all. I can double loop the bands for more resistance, but I was looking for bands that had less stretch than these do. I honestly will not repurchase and most likely end up tossing them in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: J.Auve

customer_reviews.title: These have a toxic smell to them. They have ...
customer_reviews.text: These have a toxic smell to them. They have been outside since they arrived. I do not know yet if I will be able to use them...
customer_reviews.author: Emily Porter

customer_reviews.title: Eh, I mean, for the price...
customer_reviews.text: They work. But I only use them an hour a day and after less than a month they are stretched enough that only the black one offers any useful amount of resistance and they roll up and pinch even if you wear gym pants while using them. They are a pain to unstick and unroll between types of exercise. I think if they were thicker length wise, as in wider, they would roll less. Not sure of a solution for they losing resistance so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Find Something Else
customer_reviews.text: Three months into using these bands, they just get worse. They roll and ride up. I try to double band them and they stick together, making it difficult to keep up with my workout. Once they roll up, I have to pause my workout because it takes so much time to get them flat again. Not to mention, getting them into that little bag is quiet the feat. There isn't an easy way to slide them in since the suction together upon touching.
customer_reviews.author: ketchupbottle

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, won't last long.
customer_reviews.text: These were great at first, but they have started to warp after a few weeks of use. Especially the black one, which is getting narrow/thin spots and looks like it might not last much longer. The logo is peeling off of them also, and little tiny bits of white paint are getting everywhere when I use them. I'm not using them in any extreme way, either, just normal use on an almost daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: I am a large woman so it may work better for the petite crowd
customer_reviews.text: These rolled up into narrow band uncomfortable for me. I am a large woman so it may work better for the petite crowd.
customer_reviews.author: lialexgma

customer_reviews.title: The price is great on these bands
customer_reviews.text: The price is great on these bands, but they are suuuuuuuuuper slippery. They don't stay in place which is frustrating. But at least they don't roll up and pull your leg hair!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Nelson

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: OKAY. This is the BEST product I’ve bought on amazon in a while. I’ve used these and incorporated them into my workout, for my glutes, thighs and abs, and I swear to god I have lost 5.5 lbs in 3 weeks, and gained muscle in all the right places. Just increase your resistance each week, and be consistent. I can’t believe I went this long without these. If you’re wondering if they work, I promise you they do. Buy these and change your life. I use the workout for women app and use these in every workout. Life changing.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: LATEX WARNING!!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you read that these Are latex!!! I didn’t and paid for it dearly. They are full of the powdery latex residue as well. Says in the description that they don’t smell like rubber but they do. It’s my fault for not reading what they were made from but I’m currently suffering from an allergic reaction to latex in my eyes after using these for the first time. I was working out. Sweating. Wiped my eyes and they instantly started burning.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Roll quickly
customer_reviews.text: These bands roll up as soon as you put them on and start moving. Making then feel more like a tourniquet than a resistance band.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Garbage! Broke in the middle of my client doing Abduction Side Steps. She felt very embarrased.
customer_reviews.text: This low quality piece of you know what broke on my client while she was performing a common side step exercise for her Glute medius. She was totally embarrassed as she is a little overweight. I had to make up a story that the bands have lasted 2 years of heavy use and it was about time it break. I bought SKLZ bands for a slightly higher price and never had this issue. The SKLZ bands are of higher quality that is immediately apparent. DO NOT BUY THIS HORRIBLE BANDS! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, 5 different strength, affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: I think is pretty awesome. At first, I thought they were all the same strength. But after washing it, and I realized there are actually different strength. From light to extra heavy. I compared the price in store and Amazon, amazon is cheaper that 5 belts for $12 and store is offering 3 belts for $12. The light belt seems very thin... not sure if it is durable enough. The extra heavy is the thickest, seems pretty strong and durable. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Heleb87

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for a year, using them 2 to 5 times per week. While overtime they do stretch a bit, none have snapped and still work very well. Very good quality for the price. I would highly recommend. For what it’s worth, I typically used the red and black, sometimes double looping for leg and glute work. The yellow was also useful for certain upper body exercises.
customer_reviews.author: K. David

customer_reviews.title: Bands came in perfect condition, well packaged in individual plastic wrappers which ...
customer_reviews.text: Bands came in perfect condition, well packaged in individual plastic wrappers which were then packaged in a small carry bag. Very compact and easy to carry to and from the gym. Bands are a little smaller width wise than I might've liked but overall fits the need perfectly. Would recommend/buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: High quality, thick gauge bands of different strengths
customer_reviews.text: The rubber in these bands is great quality and very durable. I purchased another brand before these and it was much thinner and I stretched it out in a matter of a few months. I feel like the thicker gauge rubber will make these last much longer! Plus, for a little more money I got a variety pack of band strengths and the other brand I purchased I only got one band!
customer_reviews.author: GinaBina

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price but ALL THE VALUE! Work your muscles literally anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I wasn't expecting them to be so durable, but the extra heavy one is legitimately solid and I'm not afraid to do deep lunges or squats with these. I have a couple sitting next to my bed so I can get a couple extra reps in before I sleep, and they're so portable I bring them to the gym to have a variety of resistance exercises with me. I LOVE the guide and discovered that there was more than lower-body strength these puppies are good for! For the price of just 10 bucks or so, my whole family is now wanting a set!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAmateur

customer_reviews.title: Not good bands. They roll up
customer_reviews.text: This resistance bands are not good at all.. I was super excited to receive them but no matter what I use (leggings, shorts, biker shorts, etc) the bands roll up and after a while they get super sticky and its really hard to un-roll them. Its really annoying because it happens when I'm trying to finish a workout and they keep rolling and rolling and I have to lose time trying to fix them. I thought it was only me but after I read the reviews I saw that other people are having the same issue. I have to buy another resistance bands in order to accomplish my workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Lnc

customer_reviews.title: Very good bands, but it took a mint
customer_reviews.text: I like these. Good resistance, good range among the different levels of resistance. Easy to bring on the road. I deducted a star, though, because they arrived absolutely reeking of mildew. I could barely be in the same room with them, much less use them. I soaked them for a couple of days in a solution of cool water and fungicide (in this case, Odoban), which fortunately does not seem to have loosened them. I then hung them near an open window, out of the sun but with good sir flow. After about 4 weeks (it took that long), they finally smelled just like these bands should smell. I'm delighted with them now, but what a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: NYCShopper

customer_reviews.title: Different strength option
customer_reviews.text: Changing my review from one star to a 5 star because I’m an idiot and didn’t read the descriptions. I originally gave a bad review because I tried one of the bands and there was no resistance at all. I thought all 5 bands were the same but it turns out they had reistance from extra light to extra heavy. After trying the heavier ones, the resistance was better and I was getting a better work out. I love that they have different options in the band strength so beginners can start from scratch. Note to self...learn to read descriptions better! Lol
customer_reviews.author: J.C

customer_reviews.title: Versatile tool loved by P/Ts and Me Too
customer_reviews.text: My PT's LOVE bands for everything. These bands are on the thin side so for people who are VERY strong? They might break in a few months. I'm doing not only P/T exercises with these but am finding other exercises that are very helpful. The website is good and you can just watch what other people do in the gym and add the bands for resistance. I like that they come in a pouch that I can easily put anywhere. The website, instructions are really good. I'm enjoying them a lot.
customer_reviews.author: pep

customer_reviews.title: Love them BUT latex ALLERGY
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love them so far. Super transportable, small bag, lightweight, and multi strengths. Use them at work or for quick lazy workouts before bed or in the morning. It comes with an easy to read pamphlet on exersises and useful tips. My only con is that the bands are latex and you definitely smell it and feel it. Wear protective clothing so it doesn't pull on hair or skin. It does mention in the pamphlet that the bands are latex so if you have an ALLERGY... BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Warm up only
customer_reviews.text: These bands would be perfect for a physical therapy type of situation, or for an older user. Ideally in a situation where the bands are moved in a slow, controlled, non-vigorous manner. This is because they tend to roll and stick for anything behind and basic, textbook movement, making them ineffective. They are good for stretching and basic isolation movements, nothing more. If toy think you workout regularly and think these will add top your home workout, you are wrong. They will add mostly frustration.
customer_reviews.author: HealthyMexican

customer_reviews.title: Make the Booty pop
customer_reviews.text: I really just wanted bands to help with form and resistance while doing leg press, but with the WAP release of Cardi B, I felt undying need of making the booty pop. I wanted something that would be twerk worthy, but science said that most of that is genetics. I could gain more weight, but that would probably go straight to the tummy and make it stick out farther than my breasts. At least these bands help my booty workout, so someday you'll be able to bounce a quarter off it.
customer_reviews.author: Loraleesignaturedrinks

customer_reviews.title: Strong,durable, & soft bands with varied strengths (light,  light, medium, heavy & X Heavy
customer_reviews.text: I like these super stretch super bands very much as, they are perfect for strengthening my Gluts (medius and Maximus) & hips, etc. Plus they came with 4 different strengths Extra light, light, medium,heavy and X-Heavy (varied colors for each) which are all great depending on then exercises that you need or, want to do. They also came with-in a nice little bag that's totally reuseable to keep them orgainzed. I also liked that they came with a user guide pamphlet and they provided a web site for video Guide. I've only used them a couple of times so far, so I cannot say that they is anything that I don't like about them. Thank you,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality - band broke under normal stretch. No reply from company.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bands less than 6 months ago, and have used them perhaps 20 times. There was no visible defect on inspection. While doing biceps curls, the red "heavy" band snapped under normal stretch. My fist hit my lip, which was swollen but fortunately not lacerated. Evidently the bands do not meet design criteria. 1. Quality of the bands is unsatisfactory, and can result in injury during use. 2. The company did not respond to inquiry for support or replacement. 3. Company website claims to offer superior quality, 100% customer satisfaction and lifetime warranty. These are empty words apparently. One must read reviews to discriminate between honorable and misleading claims.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Liked at first but disappointed, don’t recommend buying!
customer_reviews.text: In the last couple years I’ve had to buy 2 sets because the bands had tears & eventually ripped. I really liked em at first when I first bought em but now I definitely do NOT recommend buying! Better off getting bands that are wider & more durable. These also get annoying while working out with because they roll a lot so sometimes you gotta hold em in place while exercising. They’re not very durable. After this 2nd set ripping, I’m not buying another one. I’m gonna go with something better. So inconvenient, I want my money back...
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Good but didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as I am on an extended traveling experience. I have had this product for about 7 months and one of the bands started tearing and is no longer usable. Fit Simplify support was understanding and said that they would issue a refund. Unfortunately, I can't replace the product because I am traveling and the shipping costs are too high. I do like the product when it worked and I used it 4 or 5 times a week but it really didn't last very long. For most people, this won't be as big of an issue as it will be easier to get a replacement if you are already in an Amazon delivery area.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: First thing you'll notice is that these bands smell terrible which only gets worse once you begin using them (and it rubs off on your hands). I find these to be on the small side which limits their usability. After a few uses, I found a slight tear in the side of the red band which leaves me skeptical of their durability. I won't be using these anymore. Not very surprising seeing as these are the same exact bands being sold on aliexpress.
customer_reviews.author: Brandyn

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and get longer bands,
customer_reviews.text: If you were looking to loop these over your shoulders to increase pushup difficulty , or to do leg extensions, or other shoulder range of motion exercises they are just not long enough. As noted in other reviews they somewhat stick to themselves and are difficult to grip. I though of chaining a few together , but I believe once looped you would have a very very difficult time to unhook them . Not a bad price, but not quite heavy duty enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Capps

customer_reviews.title: They’re excercise bands. Here’s what I think of them...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Bought these for the family to get better strength of targeted muscle groups (rotator cuff, et al). So far they’ve worked well. I read a lot of reviews that complained about everything from breaks to having the bands roll while using. Yes, they will eventually break. Take care of them and use them often. And yes, they will roll if you apply too much lateral pressure. I’ve owned other bands before (physical therapy issued). These are a lot smaller, so they certainly don’t do what the “real” ones do. However, for what I bought them for, they’re fine. If they break, I may buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Wilderness Techno GeekTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good, until they weren’t. Avoid intense heat!
customer_reviews.text: These where great l, until they weren’t . I was using them 2-3 times a week and kept them in my home gym (garage). I noticed they would get roll up, get flimsy and stick together (I used I pairs for my ideal resistance) but where still usable for another workout session. However, after this week’s intense heat wave (108 in LA!?!) I was getting ready to use when I notice 2 of my bands had melted together. And when I tried to separate them they ripped! So sad! Maybe had I kept in a cooler place they would have been fine, but I didn’t want to bring back and forth between my house and my gym every time.
customer_reviews.author: Dai.Vill.

customer_reviews.title: Buy some better ones!
customer_reviews.text: These bands are very thin and not versatile at all. The first time I used these bands they were ok but I was really scared they were going to tear and snap. The 2nd time I tried using using them on my thighs and all they did was roll up and would not stay in place at all so I'm definitely returning.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Great for warmups + finishers
customer_reviews.text: I love! Using these for warmups and finishers are the best. Given me the best glute pumps I’ve ever had. The extra strong one isn’t as strong as my Lovotex fabric one, but the heaviness range of these is ideal for warmups+finishers. Only issue: used less than 2 weeks and the extra light one has a minor rip already, but that was partially my fault; I should have been using the next one or two up for the exercise I was doing. Overall, even if I need to replace in a couple months, they were a great deal and will do it in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quarantine 15? Not today.
customer_reviews.text: So let's be clear, these resistance bands aren't going to make you lose that Quarantine 15 all on their own. It's going to require the discipline to make time to exercise. Whether you're staying at home or travel, these resistance bands are perfect as they fold down nicely and come in a very easy to carry pouch. Even when the gym opens back up, you might not be willing to start pawing all those public surfaces, and carrying these resistance bands can help minimize the number of questionable surfaces you'll be coming in contact with. Overall very happy with the purchase and look forward to seeing just how durable these actually are (for now they seem sturdy enough).
customer_reviews.author: Enos One

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: This package came with bands from very light to very heavy, which was nice. However, they are not very wide and when stretched they fold over in half. One of them sticks to itself when it folds over. Also, they are painful because they dig into your leg or arm when they fold over because they are so narrow. I am returning them.
customer_reviews.author: MabelLucy

customer_reviews.title: Works great as total gym resistance band
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Total Gym. instead of adding the actual weights to make the exercise harder, I decided to buy these resistance bands and use them as extra weight when I work on total gym. I had for few weeks and it works like a charm. it gives you plenty of resistance when I work out and way easier to change and less dangerous. I am sure that there are other types of exercise for using these, but for me, it works out absolutely perfect for my total gym resistance bands. thanks. this was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Y. YoonTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to have for exercise purposes during a 2 month business trip overseas. They were completely worthless and unless any other exercise bands I have ever had. Wish I could return them but it's been a while because of the trip; I'll see about it. They were impossible to use in any proper way to get any proper range of motion and resistance. Just a total waste of money. Don't do it. Get something better.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Quality exercise bands
customer_reviews.text: These bands are good quality and the variety of difficulty in stretching is great (i.e. five different strengths vs. three). I did find the two lighter strength bands rolled a bit on my calves when I was wearing workout tights but I believe this is because they are a lighter weight rubber, and I found this brand to be much better at staying put than others I have tried. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Love2shop

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy except the black and red ones.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to workout my arms, it's snapped on me and I haven't used it much. When I took it out of the packaging I noticed most of the bands felt too thin to be usable and really flimsy. I had to be careful while using these ones until I built up the strength and endurance to use the red and black ones.
customer_reviews.author: Disha

customer_reviews.title: Curl up when stretched
customer_reviews.text: First set I've owned. The only con is that they seem to curl up and not stay flat when stretched and moved up or down. So if you've got them around your legs for example and are stretching one leg back, the band will curl up and be a hard thick pressure in one spot as opposed to laying flat against your leg. Makes certain exercises slightly less comfortable. Other than that, they provide great resistance, are easy to travel with, and really do add a challenge to home work outs. They come with a booklet that provides exercises. They fit neatly and easily in the carrier bag.
customer_reviews.author: Shawkins

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not durable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these resistance bands primarily for physical therapy/rehabilitation after a minor shoulder injury, then for ongoing maintenance of that shoulder—mostly doing pull aparts with the two lightest bands. While they are sufficient for the job, one of them snapped mid-exercise and another is showing heavy tears—that one will snap, I’m sure, if I use it again. Both of these are shown in the photo. All in all, decent considering the price. But I would like them to be a bit more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua VanDeBrake

customer_reviews.title: ... a review on these a week or so a good because I was no happy with having the bands ...
customer_reviews.text: I did a review on these a week or so a good because I was no happy with having the bands for less than 2 weeks and 1 snapped. I did not think I would be able to return it because it was used. I have to say this company read my review and within a few days I had a delivery at my door with a brand new set with no questions asked. I am happy very pleased with this prompt response from Fit Simply. They really want their customers happy. They aim to please. Thank you. Now I can continue with my 80 Day Obsession work out!
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Multiple bands have broken
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a set of these and within a week one of the bands broke. The manufacturer was kind enough to send me a replacement set, not just the one that broke. In subsequent weeks I've had a total of 4 bands break, one of them breaking and the rubber hitting me in the face. My wife found that funny, I did not. The different levels of resistance are nice, but the red and yellow ones broke quickly, and the green one broke after about a month. To be clear, I was even using them according to their guide, so I was not stressing them out beyond what they were advertised to do.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Resistance questionable
customer_reviews.text: The 'light' (blue) resistance band is harder to pull than the 'medium' (yellow) so either they are labelled incorrectly or made incorrectly. Secondly, I can tell no difference between the 'heavy' (red) and the 'X-heavy' (black) bands when I use them. The black is thicker than the red but the resistance feels the same. Lastly, depending on how they are used, these bands do roll up sometimes but that's likely the case for all of these types of bands.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Brittle and develop cracks and snap
customer_reviews.text: I had these for 6 months and maybe used them 2-3 times each. After just sitting in my fitness room I noticed they started to develop tears or cracks. When I tried pulling them after that they just snapped apart and one whipped me pretty hard. I discarded all of them even the undamaged ones after that incident. Definitely avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Cher

customer_reviews.title: Only comes in 12inches
customer_reviews.text: The resistance loops are good but wished they come in 9 inches as well. I was using them for the Beachbody 80-day obsession but found them to be too long for the exercises. Autumn mentioned in her video that she uses the 9-inch resistance loop and I ended up buying 9 inches after having difficulty with the 12-inch loops. Otherwise, I like these bands better than another company that I purchased that were 12-inch resistance loop. The only reason for the 4 stars is the lack of a smaller resistance loop option.
customer_reviews.author: nbrown0200

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resistance loops
customer_reviews.text: I need exercise bands and resistance loops to help me get gentle exercise. These work great for my leg exercises (haven't tried them for arm exercises but they should work well too). I have had my set for over a year with no issues with durability. The only issue I notice is that the lighter weight bands tend to get a little rolled on themselves if you are not careful. They can be unrolled but it's a bit of a pain. I still liked them enough to order a second set for traveling because I use them so frequently.
customer_reviews.author: L & R

customer_reviews.title: Impressive quality
customer_reviews.text: Was really impressed with the quality of these bands! They are thicker than others I've used but I think that lends to each resistance level being more suitable and difficult for gradual increase in challenge. I would definitely order them again if anything happened to my current set though. Love that it comes with 5, not just 3, different resistant level bands AND a storage/travel bag so I can't easily lose them! The material is also very easy to clean or disinfectant after those super sweaty workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Good product; not as strong as I thought they would be.
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I bought these bands. I have used them many times so far for hip strengthening. They were a decent price as well. Only negative is that I feel as if they could be more resistant/strong. I have fairly strong hips but am using the red band (2nd strongest). I sometimes feel as if I could even snap that. As I improve strengthening, I wonder if I will find that they are all too easy. However, I am sure I could go through the instructions/Ebook and find some upper body activities in which the lower resistance bands will be well suited. Good product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I just received these so my review can only be brief. They appear a better quality than bands I’ve had over the years. They’re thicker , yet still feel comfortable when using. They have the resistance needed. Some I’ve had in the past didn’t seem to give as much resistance. I like the bag it comes with, for traveling and also for storage. My work out room has a lot of sunlight come in so it’s good for storage so they don’t wear out from the sun. These bands are great for a lot of gluten and lower body exercises that are simple but very effective. They’re always in my work out routine, even when lifting weights.
customer_reviews.author: Paris

customer_reviews.title: Adds variation to a leg routine
customer_reviews.text: These add variation to your daily routine. The black one is strong enough to do lateral squats and actually feel it the next day when you are off your heavy lift day. The blue one and the yellow one can help you put some resistance on your kick backs or hip thrusts. I don't really use them for any arm exercises but I definately do use them for a lighter leg day to break my routine an add some crazy exercises in there. Oh the black band does not roll up while squatting, even when one does a lateral walk which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Edyta K

customer_reviews.title: A strong odor...
customer_reviews.text: Right off the bat, all I can say is that the smell is just awful. These have a VERY strong odor of rubber that I, personally, cannot stand. I tried washing them to no avail. The smell would even linger on me after using them. To help the air-out process I stored them out of the bag on a window ledge. Not sure if it was the sun exposure, but one day I went to use one and it just snapped. Grabbed another and it did the same thing. Even the heaviest one snapped when my boyfriend stretched it. I gave it two stars instead of one since they worked fine until they broke. But overall, no good.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Wide Range of Resistance
customer_reviews.text: Because of such a wide range I don't use all the bands, which is a little disappointing and feels a little wasteful. Realistically I use 2 of the 5. Sturdiness makes nervous because the bands are thin but non of them have broken. They do roll up and down. I got a little meat on my bones so I can only imagine someone who is even thicker than me having an even worse time with it. I appreciate that it comes with a little bag to hold them all in, that's convenient. Overall I still recommend this product, just be aware of the rolling and the wide range of resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Zahniser

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have Bands fir Versatility
customer_reviews.text: I used my bands when I worked out with my trainer on Zoom today. Each band came individually wrapped. The bands were beautifully packaged. We used every band from the lightest weight (light green) to the black one. My trainer worked my arms, deltoids, triceps, and we also used the bands for ankles, too! I am so pleased that the tension level is clearly marked on each band. I plan to take these with me when we travel in their own little bag. I think these bands are a great value and I plan to use them in regular workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B.

customer_reviews.title: Good but became too light
customer_reviews.text: I bought these at the beginning of the year when I did 80 Day Obsession because I wanted to save money since BOD can get expensive. I used them for all of phase 1 of the program but these became way too light, way too quicly for me. That was even when I would double or triple the bands too. Overall they're not bad but if you're going to use them for harder type workouts and looking to build strength, I wouldn't recommend these. They're too light I think. After phase 1 of the program I just ended up buying BOD loops because they were the strength I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: When I decided to order the loop bands it was overwhelming because there are just so many options. So I went to my trainer and asked her what brand she uses. I know for certain that these are good because they are passed around in our HIIT classes. Weeks and weeks of use my folks of all different abilities and sizes. I have only used the black and the red but they didn't roll up. Sometimes it happens but so far not yet. I would not hesitate to purchase these again!
customer_reviews.author: Mizzpiggee

customer_reviews.title: just like what my therapist had me using
customer_reviews.text: i don't expect item to last for years so then when i expect it will break in a few months doesn't bother me. it looks exactly like resistance bands used by therapist when i was recovering from fall. (likely it is exactly same material since my therapist had a roll of it (hundreds of feet?) color coded resistance values are easy to identify with descriptive resistance printed for the color blind consumers and a simple 1-5 star quantity to identify resistance for those illiterate users that is also color blind. .
customer_reviews.author: the all powerful qaz

customer_reviews.title: They work, but they don't feel all that great
customer_reviews.text: These definitely work for resistance bands in a pinch. I think the problem here is that they feel like they might snap eventually, they stick to themselves a bit when you put them back in without the initial plastic wrapping the individual bands come with, and on the skin they feel kinda weird. This might be because I am used to fabric resistance bands that are a whole lot nicer. All that being said, they're an alright value for the price and perhaps I'm expecting too much.
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I have these for about 6 months now. I only use the red and black. Occasionally I use the yellow for arms. I, so far had no issues. Yes, the lightweight ones do roll up. The heavier ones less and it really depends on the exercise. To avoid rolling as well as to improve some excercises I use different heavy bands for legs. None of them snapped on me yet. I do make sure to put some baby powder on them so they don’t stick. Be careful of asbestos in baby powder. Try getting those based on cornstarch rather than talc
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth The Frustration
customer_reviews.text: These are the most frustrating things - they not only roll but when they do they stick together! I end up spending more time unsticking the dumb things than I do on the exercise! I could deal with the rolling - most bands do that but the stickiness drives me nuts. Unfortunately I bought these a over a month ago in preparation for my workouts so I missed the return window 👎🏼
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hubble

customer_reviews.title: These bands roll and are low resistance
customer_reviews.text: The only two worth using are the heavy and extra-heavy; the others barely provide resistance. I am fit but not so strong that I should be able to use the highest resistance band with ease, and that is the one I use. All of the bands except the heaviest roll, the primary issue I had with my last set of bands. I am going with the cloth ones that done roll.
customer_reviews.author: Julia G.

customer_reviews.title: Too short for what I need
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with the Fit Simplify Resistance Loop Exercise Bands. The bands are very short so that I cannot use them to do bicep curls. I like the fact that there are a number of sizes that came with this but all are the same length. They are good on my legs for squats and lunges. I have not had any break but only used them for two weeks. The carrying bag is useless so I am not going to attempt to put the bands in and take with me to the gym. I would not recommend them unless you were only going to use for legs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for home workouts
customer_reviews.text: I love these more than my kettle bells and dumbells for home workouts lately. They include a little pamphlet with some exercise recommendations, but search online for exercise ideas if you need them. I love the different tensions so I can build up my strength, the lightness and easy of transport for future travel (hopefully one day). I am currently pregnant and enjoy a challenging strength routine, within reason, and find these feel like the right amount of challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Banta

customer_reviews.title: The bands are good, could use a larger storage bag.
customer_reviews.text: The bands are perfect for at-home PT exercises and I am happy with my purchase. The only thing that I am not happy with is the storage bag. The bag is actually why I picked this product over a dozen similar products, but it's so small that it gets lost in all my other at home equipment and you have to cram the bands in it to get them to fit. I thought it would be bigger, but I didn't really pay attention to the picture, so prob my fault anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Darkwoodriding

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Easy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first resistance band purchase. I was cautious when buying because I have heard that most do not last. But these do! I use them quite frequently and their elasticity is still like when they were new. I like that they come with all different strength levels so I can switch depending on what I am working on. My only complaint is that they do ride up when I am using them on my legs, but I don’t think there are any out there that stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional, Multi-Purpose (exercise, therapeutic) Bands!
customer_reviews.text: As a nurse, I am very aware of good body mechanics. However, without this knowledge, I would have no difficulty in effectively using these resistance bands! The included insert provides a visual guide of a number of exercises that cumulatively allow for a full body work out, or even simply stretching and therapeutic range of motion. The resistance range covers all the bases and after many uses, they have held up and remain good as new. Cannot beat this product for the price, equally as good as more expensive options!
customer_reviews.author: Sara A.

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: 3 out of 5 broke by using them during simple leg exercises. These are made thin, so they snap easily. I gave up using the last two. I’m searching elsewhere for new bands made of fabric, instead of plastic like this. These bands roll up/down too much, so constant adjustments are needed to be made during work out. Not good quality. Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good feel, but they do not last long
customer_reviews.text: Pro: They did not pinch the skin as much as some other bands. Con: They did not last long. I only use the Heavy (Red) and the Very Heavy (Black). After about 30 days, the red band got stretched/weaker and then broke. I started using the black. It was too hard at first, but after it got weaker it was just about right. However it also broke. I wish they lasted longer. If you go directly to their web site, they sell packs of 5 red and/or 5 black. However, they cost about twice as much as the current sale (the variety pack is currently $8.50 on Amazon; $15.95 direct ... whereas 5 black bands is $17.95 direct from manufacturer).
customer_reviews.author: picky mom

customer_reviews.title: Functional and well-made
customer_reviews.text: I've been really happy with this product. I keep this set of resistance bands near my at-home work desk, so I can slip in some resistance training throughout the day. I like the fact that there are 5 different bands, so I can pick the right one for the job. I'd recommend these to anyone wanting to use resistance bands for their workout. I've even kept one around my ankles while I walk through my house. I look goofy, for sure, but it's a good leg workout!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great quality resistance bands
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I needed. They are high quality and I appreciate that each band is labeled so you know what level of resistance you are using. I have MS and needed these to help with some physical therapy and they are perfect! Also, I appreciate the little pouch they fit in and the pamphlet showing you different exercises you can do.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Buy the better Letsfit brand instead, better quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had several sets of these and they all failed after a couple of months. Now it is in the nature of things that material fatigue will occur and these things have a limited life. I tried contacting customer service to see if I could just order 5 of the heavy bands. I got no reply. So I tried another brand—Letsfit. The products look identical, with the exception of the branding, so I assumed they came out of the same Chinese factory. But it appears the Letsfit brand is quite superior. I got 5 months out of the Letsfit brand.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't receive all bands
customer_reviews.text: I just received them, haven't used them yet. They seem like fine quality, I plan to use them. However, I only received four of the five bands. The green one is missing. It's likely that I probably wouldn't need the X-Light one anyways, so I'm not going to make a fuss, it's just a little frustrating. They do however have a strong rubber smell. We'll see how it goes!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can find better.
customer_reviews.text: These are small! I made the mistake of not double checking size prior to purchasing, but the low-star rating does not come from that mistake. The durability is quite low in my opinion. After one usage, all levels of resistance stretched and we're less effective on second use and so on. I used them to create resistance during lateral/walking squats.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Capati

customer_reviews.title: Great quality item.
customer_reviews.text: I use these bands to help build my lower back strength as I have a herniated disk that flares up from time to time. I began using these bands in physical therapy and they were a big part of my healing. I also use them for exercise and fitness. They were delivered quickly and I like the durable bag/case they came in. It makes them very easy to transport in my purse or bag. I would definitely recommend this product and this company.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Carmody

customer_reviews.title: Good bands, better service
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't a fan of these originally because they had stuck together but Fit Simplify replaced them and upgraded me to the Pro=series which better fits my needs. This particular set is indeed a bit weak for what I'm looking for, which is the reason for the 4 stars and not 5, but they are great quality bands and the customer service Fit Simplify provides is amazing. If I ever need a replacement I'll likely go the pro series, but the service attached to this product has made me a customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Band snapped within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I got these bands and they were good at first - I understand what people mean about rolling up, but that may be due to sweating (when bands are dry they don't roll up, when they are wet - forget it). But not even 2 months after purchasing them the red one snapped on me. I wasn't even doing much to stretch it - I am careful not to over stretch them. Now I am missing the most important one - the red band. I think resistance bands are amazing for working out - these just leave much to be desired. Buy another brand. I guess I am going to have to...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Youmans

customer_reviews.title: Got it for kids , wife her sister and other people here.
customer_reviews.text: Got it for kids , wife her sister and other people here. Purchased as an additional item suggested. Wife asked me if I thought she was getting fat... No Way Honey, it is your sister . Hahaha I was okay. I did snap everybody with one to capture their attention! I've used similar items for therapy. Looks nice and provided entertainment as unsuspecting victims got snapped! :-)
customer_reviews.author: GreatDanes4U

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for quarantine
customer_reviews.text: Prior to the outbreak of Covid-19 I had been working out with a trainer at my gym. In order to maintain my physical fitness I needed something simple that would not require a lot of room as I live in a small space. These are great! There's a variety of resistance from light to heavy you can switch out depending on the workout routine. The customer service is polite and super quick to respond. A+++++ product and A+++++ seller Thank you, Fit Simplify!
customer_reviews.author: LAStout

customer_reviews.title: Not very resistant.
customer_reviews.text: I had a black band from a different company and the strongest band in this package was half the resistance that one had. If you're looking for lightweight resistance it's fine, but if you need something stronger, go for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: The Love Gurus

customer_reviews.title: Quality and value
customer_reviews.text: My PT (Physical Therapist, or as I call him, personal torturer) has broken a bunch of this style bands. I decided to get some for myself, and got these Fit Simplify bands at a good price. These are better quality than my PT has. I like the range of tensions for different exercises, and the color code makes it easier to remember. Also, the little storage bag is surprisingly helpful - I thought it was too extra, but now I use it and it is Handy!
customer_reviews.author: MagicSkip

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. However, try not to use it on abrasive surfaces as it will degrade the quality of the product. This is my go-to equipment when I'm traveling and don't have access to a gym. It doesn't slip and combining the bands gives you very strong resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect ordering something like this online. What I got was really good quality and exactly what I was looking for. These are the loop bands not just one piece that isn't connected, if that makes any sense. The different resistances help to make a variety of workouts possible. Really easy to use also. Anyone could use these. Body weight exercises are a great workout to get in shape. They also don't take up very much space so you can take them anywhere with you or put them in a drawer out of sight. Nothing bulky or taking up too much room.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Evans

customer_reviews.title: Needed for physical therapy sessions
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived speedily. My physical therapist wanted me to have some of these to use at home for my at-home therapy. I've been using them for a couple types of exercise. Has helped me increase my shoulder's movement. I will say that the little pouch that comes to store them in is a bit too small to get them all back in once you remove them. Even a half-inch larger all the way around would help. But the bag isn't that nice so I won't be using it. I think a ziploc bag would be better: bigger and easier to see what is inside it.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Probably has fake reviews
customer_reviews.text: I don’t see how these could have such high reviews. There must be a lot of fake ones. The are super thin. I don’t see them lasting me very long. They roll and are hard to keep not from rolling. They’ll do the job until they break guess. Not sure if work the 18$.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Terrible! Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I used bands when in physical therapy for ACL & loved them! But these are inferior quality. 1st they stretch out easily & don't retain their shape. They stick together making them impossible to use. Lastly the "heavy" bands aren't tough enough & I'm no athlete!
customer_reviews.author: S. willoughby

customer_reviews.title: Company increased price when Coronavirus hit
customer_reviews.text: Although the product works and is good. As soon as the coronavirus hit the company took advantage of customers and increase the price by 50%... When I purchased it it was only seven dollars
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine G.

customer_reviews.title: Not That Good
customer_reviews.text: I got these so I could continue PT at home after formal sessions at clinic. These bands were not as strong as those my therapist uses. I had to use the "Very Heavy" bands and they were about half the resistance of what my therapist uses. I will be asking my therapist brand she uses. These are just barely OK. If you're in therapy and need clinic grade bands I would shop around and find something more robust. I didn't look up the e-book or video so I won't comment on those...
customer_reviews.author: Drew Phx

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The band ripped on the first use. I don’t want to continue to use it because I know it’ll snap and hurt me. Do not waste your time or money buying these
customer_reviews.author: Alondra Del Hierro

customer_reviews.title: but the quality is not that good so they roll up like rubber bands and dig ...
customer_reviews.text: they are work out bands ..... but the quality is not that good so they roll up like rubber bands and dig into your legs. I was informed to try a stronger band - heavy. I did. It rolled to a stronger rubber and that dug into my legs. Maybe if you are skinny with lots of hard muscle in your legs it will work better for you?
customer_reviews.author: for real

customer_reviews.title: Keeps rolling up!
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with these. I just starting using them and they roll all the time. I first thought itscuz I was using too light off of band, switched to heavier and they all roll. A couple of them also leaves a white residue on my gym pants. I'll keep using them even tho they hurt a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Marlize T.

customer_reviews.title: Atrocious Chemical Smell
customer_reviews.text: When I took the bands out of the plastic, there was an instantaneous strong chemical smell--so much so, my eyes watered. I left them out for over an hour, hoping that the smell would go away. It didn't. After initially handling them, the smell wouldn't leave my hands--even if I tried wiping them. I had to wash with hot water and soap to get this smell off. I would rather buy more expensive bands in the store, than use these.
customer_reviews.author: C. Li

product_meta.title: Fit Simplify Resistance Loop Exercise Bands for Home Fitness, Stretching, Strength Training, Physical Therapy, Workout Bands, Pilates Flexbands, Set of 5
product_meta.description:
Resistance Bands - 5 Loop Fitness Bands Set - Exercise Resistance Loop Bands - Exercise Bands For Legs And Arms - Carry Bag


Are you ready for the most versatile, results producing workout bands on the market?

These bands are ideal for 
- Sports 
- Fitness 
- Injury rehabilitation 
- body shaping 
- weight loss 
- physical therapy 


How do our bands differ?

First, our bands are made of highest quality 100% genuine eco-friendly latex (not rubber bands which are much cheaper and tend to break easily). They are stronger and able to stretch further. You will feel the same resistance after a dozen reps. 

These bands are free of non-natural materials such as Thermoplastic Elastomer (TPE) - TPE materials cost 40% less, are not gentle to skin and much less durable. 

Second, our bands are comfortable, soft and easy on the skin. The only way to achieve that is to let the latex rest for a long time in tightly controlled circumstances such as temperature and humidity before making the bands.

Both of these involve a higher investment for us but we think it's worth it to create a better product. 


What makes our resistance bands special?

These bands are rigorously tested to be snap, stretch and sweat resistant.

You get 5 resistance bands set and you can combine multiple bands to find your ideal resistance.

These bands are so lightweight that they make a great travel fitness kit!

This is also a great Christmas, Mother's and Father's day gift idea for men, women, dad or mom.
feature_bullets: High end exercise bands. Our 12″ by 2″ heavy duty resistance loop bands are made of 100% natural latex – free of TPE – and come in 5 varying resistance levels. This makes them perfect whether you are just starting to workout or a seasoned workout warrior.

Great with any workout. This resistance band set can be integrated seamlessly with every popular workout program including Yoga, Pilates, and more. Or use them for general exercise, stretching, strength training, power weight programs.

Multiple uses. These resistance bands are often used for sports and fitness, physical therapists love these physical therapy bands to help them rehabilitate their patients. Our stretch bands work for people suffering from leg, knee and back injuries.
Superior quality. Our exercise resistance bands are easy on skin. The instruction booklet includes illustrated exercises that demonstrate how to use our resistance bands.
What you get: original USA designed exercise bands with color-coded resistance levels, portable travel carry bag and instruction guide.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
